com.adidas.ui.validator

Class CardNumber

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.adidas.ui.validator.CardNumber

  • public class CardNumber
extends java.lang.Object
    This class holds all of the logic to perform validation and formatting for a given card number. Is intended to be used within CardNumberInput but developers are free to use it in any way they want.

    • Method Detail

      • getCardTypeForNumber

        public CardType getCardTypeForNumber(java.lang.String cardNumber)
        Returns the card type associated with the cardNumber format passed as an argument.
        Parameters:
        cardNumber - the card number we want to get the type from
        Returns:
        the type associated to the card number passed as argument. It can be CardType.UNKNOWN if it's not recognized or supported at the moment

      • isValidCardNumberFormat

        public boolean isValidCardNumberFormat(java.lang.String cardNumber)
        Checks that a card number is valid against the defined specs. It must be a card number associated with a type different than CardType.UNKNOWN anc Luhn-algorithm compliant
        Parameters:
        cardNumber - Card number we want to check if it's valid or not
        Returns:
        true if it's a valid card number checked against the specs defined for the card numbers supported at the moment

      • isLuhnAlgorithmCompliant

        public boolean isLuhnAlgorithmCompliant(java.lang.String cardNumber)
        Checks that the card number is a valid one against the Luhn algorithm. This algorithm is intended to prevent typos and typing mistakes, this method won't check if a card number ACTUALLY exists on ANY database or bank, it will just check that it's valid against the algorithm used to generate the number. It has nothing to do too with the card type. A card number with CardType.UNKNOWN can return true for this algorithm.
        Parameters:
        cardNumber - the card number we want to check against Luhn Algorithm
        Returns:
        true if the card number passed is Luhn-algorithm compliant, false otherwise

      • format

        public java.lang.String format(java.lang.String cardNumber)
        Formats a card number depending on it's type introducing or removing spaces where necessary
        Parameters:
        cardNumber - card number to be formatter
        Returns:
        formatted card number

      • normalizeCardNumber

        public java.lang.String normalizeCardNumber(java.lang.String cardNumber)
        Formats the string removing spaces and dashes
        Parameters:
        cardNumber - card number to be formatted
        Returns:
        the same card number without any space or dash that it could contain

      • getMinLengthForCardType

        public int getMinLengthForCardType(CardType cardType)
        Returns the minimum number of characters needed to recognize a card number depending on the type passed as parameter. This method is intended to be used to limit the input when the user has typed a card number whose associated type is not supported
        Parameters:
        cardType -
        Returns:
